whyCallingWorks.title: Why Calling Works
whyCallingWorks.justificationForCalling: Calling members of Congress is the most effective way to have your voice heard. Calls are tallied by staffers and the count is given to your representatives, informing them how strongly their constituents feel about a current issue. The sooner your reach out, the more likely it is that your voice will influence their position.
whyCallingWorks.justificationArticlesListHeader: Don’t just take it from us:
whyCallingWorks.article1: 'Here’s Why You Should Call, Not Email, Your Legislators' NY Times
whyCallingWorks.article2: 'Don’t just write to your representatives. Call them — and go to town halls.' Vox
whyCallingWorks.article3: 'I can tell you the calls we’ve gotten in my district office and here in Washington surprised me, meaning the numbers of calls.' Washington Post
whyCallingWorks.article4: 'Most members tell me blizzard of angry constituent calls were most impt factor in getting the House to sideline the amdt' Robert Costa
whyCallingWorks.weDoTheResearch: $t(common.AppName) does the research for each issue, determining which representatives are most influential for which topic, collecting phone numbers for those offices and writing scripts that clearly articulate a progressive position. You just have to call.
whyCallingWorks.sendYourIssues: Are we not covering an issue we should be? Please reach out.

callingTips.title: Calling Tips
callingTips.callTechnique: Calls should take less than a minute. You’ll be speaking to a staffer, so make your point clearly so they can tally your opinion correctly. The provided scripts are useful but you can add your own words.
callingTips.callEtiquette: Be respectful. The staffers that pick up the phone are not looking to challenge you and you should treat them with the same respect you expect from them, regardless of which party they work for.

whoIs5Calls.title: Who made $t(common.AppName)?
whoIs5Calls.overview: $t(common.AppName) is a volunteer effort. Founded and run by husband & wife team Nick and Rebecca, many dedicated volunteers contribute design, code and issues to the site including: @monteiro, @stewartsc, @liamdanger, @capndesign, @jameshome, @beau, @cdoremus, @ocderby, @mr0grog and more supporters.
whoIs5Calls.iOSApp: Our iOS app is made by @subdigital, @mccarron, @chrisbrandow and more supporters
whoIs5Calls.androidApp: Our Android app is made by dektar, gregliest and more supporters
whoIs5Calls.contentAndSocial: Our issues, scripts and social team is @charmbtrippin, sara.n.g, amanda.l, @djpiebob, @theRati, @lhhargrave, amanda.n, @sagerke, Eleanor Wertman, @goldengateblonde, @2girls2dogs1dh and more contributors.
whoIs5Calls.whyStatement: We want to make advocacy accessible. We hope $t(common.AppName) will make it effortless for regular people to have a voice when it’s needed most.

joinUs.title: Join us
joinUs.contactInvite: This project is open source and volunteer made. If you’d like to join us in developing useful tools for citizens, please get in touch via Twitter or email.

contact.busyLineGuidance: Click here to see local office numbers

callComplete.title: Great work!
callComplete.pickAnotherIssue: Pick another issue to keep calling, or spread the word by sharing your work with friends:
callComplete.learnWhyCallingIsGreat: <0>Learn why calling</0><1> representatives is the most effective way of making your voice heard.</1>

hypothesis.title: Make your voice heard
hypothesis.p1: Turn your passive participation into active resistance. Facebook likes and Twitter retweets can’t create the change you want to see. Calling your Government on the phone can.
hypothesis.p3: Calling is the most effective way to influence your representative. Read more about why calling works.
hypothesis.contribute: You can contribute to help out with costs associated with running 5 Calls. This project is run by an all-volunteer team, and all donations go towards basic expenses like hosting our site, sending issue alerts and keeping our data updated.
hypothesis.feature1: provides phone numbers and scripts so calling is quick and easy
hypothesis.feature2: uses your location to find your local representatives so your calls have more impact

impact.title: My Impact
impact.text: You're making a difference! Calling is the most effective way to influence your representatives, and here is what you've achieved:
impact.callSummaryText: You have made contact $t(common.timeWithCount,{'count': {{contactedCalls}}}) and left $t(common.voicemailWithCount,{'count': {{vmCalls}}}). Your representatives have been unavailable $t(common.timeWithCount,{'count': {{unavailableCalls}}}).
